item.name: Manage Brackets
item.description: API end-points to manage tournament brackets.

query.description: enum(tree,list) Defaults to "list". Returns created brackets in tree or list.For **trees**, brackets will be structured recursively in a **```binary tree```**, under the ```prev_match``` attribute with the last match as root.For **lists**, brackets will be structured in an **```array```**.

item.name: Create new brackets or replace old brackets.

query.description: enum(tree,list) Defaults to "list". Returns created brackets in tree or list.For **trees**, brackets will be structured recursively in a **```binary tree```**, under the ```prev_match``` attribute with the last match as root.For **lists**, brackets will be structured in an **```array```**.
Defaults to "true". If ```empty``` is specified, players will not be added automatically. Refer to **Upsert Player in Bracket**.

request.description:
Brackets will be filled randomly with players associated with the tournament. Brackets will be build until the final bracket. This endpoint can be called again to randomly insert recently added players into the brackets.
Only tournament owner can create or replace brackets.
Calling this endpoint replaces previously generated bracket.
No body parameters are required for this end-point. Any body parameters will be ignored

Insert a player to a bracket or replace a player in a bracket. Upsert can only be done if tournament has not started yet.

<aside class="info">If upserted player is already in the tournament brackets and the bracket is already assigned to a player, then both players' position in the bracket will be swapped.</aside>
Assigns a winner to a match. Winner can only be declared if tournament is started and player comes from previous match/bracket.

response.name: Invalid Request Body

query.description: Defaults to ```1```. Values less than 1 will default to 1.
Search for tournament that contains ```name``` keyword.
Defaults to ```10```. Values less than 1 will default to 1.
Get tournaments owned by specified user with id.

request.description: Tournament list is ordered in descending order by creation time.

response.body:
{
  "count": 100,
  "total_pages": 10,
  "page": 1,
  "next_page": "/tournaments?page=2",
  "prev_page": null,
  "results": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name": "Tournament 1",
      "description": "The mind is willing, but the body is spongy and bruised",
      "started": false,
      "created_at": "1970-01-01 00:00:00",
      "updated_at": "1970-01-01 00:00:00",
      "_url": "/tournaments/1"
    }
  ]
}
response.name: Success

response.body:
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Tournament 1",
  "description": "The mind is willing, but the body is spongy and bruised",
  "started": false,
  "created_at": "1970-01-01 00:00:00",
  "updated_at": "1970-01-01 00:00:00",
  "_url": "/tournaments/1"

response.name: Created
